nasahubble1953458012414267668.content: Go, Comet 3I/ATLAS, go! Hurtling at a whopping 130,000 miles per hour, this comet has the highest velocity ever recorded for a solar system visitor. Hubble observations allow astronomers to more accurately estimate the comet's size: dir="ltr" href="https://t.co/s5XkgJcWkF" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" target="_blank" role="link" style="color: rgb(29, 155, 240);">go.nasa.gov/3UklQzV
nasahubble1953458012414267668.author: nasahubble
